did.unittitle: Capital District Senior Issues Forum Records
did.abstract: This collection contains the day-to-day work of the Capital District Senior Issues Forum.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection includes administrative materials, newsletters, event programs, correspondence, award materials, and legislative materials. Also contains biographical information on award members.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: CDSIF began as a pilot program in the late 90s focused on senior housing provision. The forum moved its headquarters from Westminster Presbyterian Church to Catholic Charities in 1999-2000 and established formal governance structure, which included an all-volunteer member Steering Committee and an Advisory Committee. The voluntary initiative organization is composed of faith communities, organizations, and individuals. Forum members come together to identify and address issues of concern for older seniors in the Capital District of New York, generate support within the faith communities, educate the Capital District about senior needs, and recognize the accomplishments of older seniors.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed in 2021 by Anna Coombs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged chronologically. There are no series.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Kitt Jackson donated all materials in this collection to the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in January 2020.
